results.title: Politics: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, David Brownlow, Arch Nicholson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A brief history of politics in Russia prior to the Revolution in 1917, through the leadership of Lenin and Stalin, into the 1970’s. Identifies the Communist Party as the source of ultimate power and attempts to explain party organisation. Photography is by Dean Semler and narration by Margaret Throsby. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Politics, power and the public good
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
A long-term popular politician, proud of “getting things done for the people”, ruthlessly fights to retain his office with a panoply of unethical tactics and henchmen. Deeply entrenched in corruption, the politician retains his office due to the efforts of his supporters who organised a mass movement of popular support for him. Edited from the film “All the King’s Men” produced and directed by Robert Rossen.

results.title: Political, economic and social developments in the Territory of Papua New Guinea. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Neil Howe
results.brief_description: For the people of Papua and New Guinea the time when the family patch of land was the basis of society and the foundation if existence is pasing. Commercial agriculture has been introduced and opportunities of wage earning are raising living standards. Main products are copra, coconut oil, coffee and cocoa. Agricultural research stations have been established by the Administration for the benefit of both white settlers and native growers. Government Co-operative buying has been introduced and new economic opportunities have enabled the people to become partners with the Administration.

results.title: Political spots
results.creator_credit: Alan Goldberg, Mickey Lemle, WQED, Lemle and Laybourne
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Media Probes”.
Political advertising revealed as an elaborate form of product packaging: in the absence of meaningful debate, image is paramount. Discusses the role of television advertising. Examples are shown and discussed with the producers. Also examines the function of opinion polling in determining media strategies. Elementary guide to the reading of TV political promo spots. Also discusses the fact that two-thirds of campaigning funds are spent on television advertising. (16mm print is kinescope transfer from video original.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Goldberg, Mickey Lemle, WQED, Lemle and Laybourne

results.title: Political power
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
There are four themes providing some answers to important questions. Who holds power in Australia? How is it distributed? What conflicts arise through the unequal distribution of power? How is it resolved? What means do Australians have to influence the decision making process? Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Political organization
results.creator_credit: Ira R. Abrams, Harry Ratner, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Faces of culture”.
In order for societies to live together with some security for all, some form of political organisation, leadership or authority must exist. This program looks at different forms of political organisation from the bands of hunter-gatherers, through tribal systems, formal leadership, nation states and theocracies to the modern state systems with their huge bureaucracies. Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: Political and legal systems
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, John Leake, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
Looks at local, state and federal governments as well as the various law courts to show how Australia has adapted the English laws of Westminster. Uses archival footage and includes segments with Malcolm Fraser and Bill Hayden.

results.title: Polite language 1: human relations and the language
results.brief_description: The main aim of this film is to illustrate the various levels of polite, informal, and informal speech found in the Japanese language. Throughout the film many examples of greetings, leave-takings, invitations, formal and informal entertaining are shown.
